metadata.title: CVE-2021-47521 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: can:sja1000: fix use after free in ems_pcmcia_add_card() If the last channel isnot available then "dev" is freed. Fortunately, we can just use "pdev->irq"instead. Also we should check if at least one channel was set up.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47521` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-100-generic - 5.4.0-100.113
linux-image-5.4.0-100-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-100.113
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-100-generic - 5.4.0-100.113
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-100-lowlatency - 5.4.0-100.113
No subscription required

linux-image-5.15.0-33-generic - 5.15.0-33.34~20.04.1
linux-image-5.15.0-33-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-33.34~20.04.1
